discussion.content: Questions like this I wish were more descriptive. Is the question specifically mentioning View Composer Persistent Disks? Or Just a persistent disk in general. If it's the former then I believe the answer is 3 as you cannot support View Composer Persistent Disks on Instant Clones. However the question is regarding any persistent disk technology, you could use App Volumes Writeable volumes with Instant clones, therefore the answer is 2. Very diffucult to answer these types of Qs and I wish the vendor worded them better!

To deploy an instant-clone desktop pool, you must first prepare a golden image virtual machine in vCenter Server
Before you recompose a linked-clone desktop pool, you must update the golden image virtual machine that you used as a base image for the linked clones.
To implement the RDS host load balancing feature, modify the RDS host golden image virtual machine.
These are copy from vmware online documents. So I think 3 . Answer is A

Is it possible that Master Image has 2 snapshots 1 with Instant Clone Agent and 2 with Composer gent - yes, this is one VM and 2nd VM for RDS. We don't need a separate VM for 3D, so my answer is B - 2 VMs.

Yeap the correct answer is 2, forget about Kiosk mode you will need to have two desktop pools .. One which will be floating and one dedicated for persistent disks. 
https://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=32793.htm
2 Images - 1 RDS and 1 Linked-Clone. I think the catch here is stateless, which can be performed if you configure Kiosk mode.
For me letter A it's correct, because is mencioned Automated RDS Farm, and to instant clone or linked clone we need a master image with snapshot created.

comments.content: Yep i agree with B. No need to MI for 3D Farm just need a VM.

The IT Team for a regional government organization wants to implement a VDI system using VMware products.

Automated Horizon RDS Farms and App Volumes to deliver a few Windows applications to iOS and Android devices
//IMG//

✑ Horizon RDS Farms to deliver a specialized 3D mapping application
✑ Stateless Windows 10 Horizon Instant Clone desktops to task workers, and Horizon Windows 10 desktops with a persistent data disk to power users
What is the minimum number of Master Image VMs to support the design?

questions.question_text:
A security team is implementing VMware Identity Manager to have a central point for authentication to facilitate access to its company's applications. The team would like to have users to authenticate to VMware Identity Manager before being able to connect to a Horizon View Desktop.
What can be done to ensure that users who try to authenticate to the Horizon View Connection brokers are forced to first authenticate to VMware Identity
Manager?

choices.D: Block connections to this RDS host at a load value of 0.
choices.B: Allow connections to this RDS host at a load value of 0.
choices.C: Allow connections to this RDS host at a load value of allow.
choices.A: Block connections to this RDS host at a load value of block.

discussion.content:
Correct answer is D.
Load Values range from 0 (Block), 1 (Low), 2 (Med), 3 (High)
https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/techpaper/vmware-horizon-view-rdsh-session-load-balancing.pdf

load VALUES: 0, 1, 2, 3
load PREFERENCES: BLOCK (do not choose this host), LOW (low preference=>high load), MED (medium preference=>normal load), HIGH (high preference=>light load)
So, D is the answer.

Hi all,

I chose D
There is no load value of BLOCK, only a preference so the correct answer would be value 0 and Preference of Block (D)

I think that the correct answer is D, because we talk about load Value not load preference.

questions.question_text:
A company has asked an architect for assistance in reviewing its design plans for distributing a finance application to its users with multiple RDS hosts using a custom load balancing script.
What can the architect recommend for a script with proper load return values to prevent overloading of an RDS host?

A company has decided to virtualize all of its helpdesk employee's workstations.
These requirements must be met:
✑ All applications used by the employees will be published through RDS hosted application.
✑ Users will NOT be allowed to store any personal data on their Horizon desktops.
✑ The Horizon desktop design should meet maximum storage space efficiency.
✑ The Horizon desktop design should meet maximum performance.
The Horizon desktop design should meet maximum power savings.
//IMG//

Which three features can be enabled to meet the company's requirements? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
seems that the question here is whether or not space-efficient disk can or should be used with instant clones
here is a possible scenario: if you build an instant clone pool with dedicated user assignment, you will be provided with an option to "refresh OS disk after logoff" with the following values: never, always, every, and at. Which means you can use an instant clone pool in the fashion of linked clones where the OS may actually never be refreshed. That implies the space-efficient disks may be useful in space reclamation while using instant clones pools. I know this is a highly unlikely scenario, but is totally possible.
Most of the instant clone use cases are are set to refresh OS at user log off which makes SE sparse useless but the above example is the exception.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.12/virtual-desktops/GUID-2D97475B-7DDF-49CF-9A41-AA832388E968.html
https://support.purestorage.com/Solutions/VMware_Platform_Guide/User_Guides_for_VMware_Solutions/VDI_User_Guide/Best_Practices%3A_Configuration_and_Tuning
BCD

BDE: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-architecture-planning/GUID-4880340C-C80C-4CE1-95FA-8692A5BFA3BC.html
"Due to short-lived nature of instant-clone desktops, instant clones do not support the space-efficient disk format (SE sparse), with its wipe and shrink process."
Correction: Space-Efficient is used on Linked Clone for Space Reclamation.
Yeap SESparse is for snapshot but what made Instant CLone possible. Answer is BCD
I think BDE, SESparse for snapshot
